translation: But know thou Tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings; it binds fast, O Arjuna, through heedlessness, indolence, and sleep.
commentary: 14.8 Inertia of darkness? You but? ignorance born of ignorance? Viddhi know? Mohanam deluding? sarvadehinam to all,embodied beings? by heedlessness by heedlessness? indolence and sleep? That that? binds binds fast? Bharata O descendant of Bharata (Arjuna).Commentary Tamas is that binding force with a tendency to lethargy? sloth and foolish actions. It causes delusion or nondiscrimination. It binds him
